strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
note: Do a short spin-jump off the left side of the elevator and hold right to make it around the ledge.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
note: Do a short spin-jump off the left side of the elevator and hold right to make it around the ledge.

strats.name: Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Leave with Runway
strats.devNote: FIXME: Is it possible to leave charged through the elevator.

226.name: Metroid Room 1

nodes.name: Junction (Get Past Metroids, Left to Right)
nodes.note: Getting to this node is to represent passing the metroids from the left, leaving it will indicate getting past the acid pit to the right.

nodes.name: Junction (Get Past Metroids, Right to Left)
nodes.note: Getting to this node is to represent passing the metroids from the right, leaving it will indicate getting past the acid pit to the left.

nodes.name: Junction (Metroid Kill Flag)
nodes.note: Getting to this node means the Metroids have been killed.

to.note: This node is to represent getting past the Metroids.
This node is to represent getting past the Metroids.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Rinka
note: Stand a bit more than a tile away from the ledge and wait for the Rinka to start moving.
Freeze the Rinka at the correct height while maintainig a half-tile gap between the Rinka and the runway to extend it as much as possible.

strats.name: Leave With Temporary Blue
strats.note: If it not possible to freeze or kill the Metroids, then move quickly enough that they get stuck off-camera to the right, and gain the shinecharge in a position where Samus can angle up and shoot the Rinka while waiting for the shinecharge timer to run out.

strats.name: Crystal Flash
note: Be sure to be at a safe distance from Rinkas before performing the Crystal Flash.

strats.name: Tank and PB Kill
note: Place Power Bombs to kill the Metroids.
By hitting the first Rinka, all of the Metroids (on a similar vertical height to the Power Bomb) will be damaged.
strats.devNote: Using 1 pack of PBs isn't intuitive as a way to kill 4 metroids without grouping them.

strats.name: PB Dodge Kill (Left to Right)
note: Group all of the Metroids by hitting the first Rinka with a Power Bomb.
Once grouped, use two more Power Bombs to finish them off.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Rinka
G-Mode Morph Power Bomb Metroid Kill
note: Kill the Metroids while artificially morphed with just Spring Ball to avoid them.
A Metroid (or a Rinka) must be completely on screen while a Power Bomb explodes in order for it to lure the other Metroids.
Because of this, with extra ammo, it is possible to kill one or two of them before luring the rest.
In general, this seems to be easiest by minimizing Samus's horizontal movement as much as possible and getting the Metroids in sync with each other while circling around her.
While moving horizontally, their movement is less predictable and harder to sync.
Note that it is necessary to exit G-Mode before exiting the room in order for the Metroids to remain killed.
strats.devNote: It is occasionally possible with just 3 Power Bombs, which doesn't make sense since the first one doesn't hit all of the Metroids.

strats.name: Shinespark Midair
strats.note: Spark through the top of the door to avoid the platforms.
strats.devNote: FIXME: Add strats that come in charged and spark to save energy.

strats.name: Metroid Room 1 Acid Skip CWJ
note: Align with the wall below the door while facing left.
Hold dash, turn around, start running and arm pump once.
Jump from the rightmost 'X' in the background.
Release forward at some point while airborne, but repress it again before the CWJ.
Immediately after the CWJ, shoot the Metroid to avoid getting grabbed.

strats.name: Blue SpaceJump, Into the Room
strats.note: Jump Immediately upon entry, or before the transition.
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: Leave Spinning (Space Jump)
devNote: FIXME: Blue speed can be used to protect against metroid damage, in the canMetroidAvoid case;
but could there be a scenario where having blue speed is incompatible for what is needed in the next room?
We made the 'blue' property for this kind of thing; the trouble is that the entrance conditions are written for either blue or not-blue, not either.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Space Jump)
Leave With Controlled Spring Ball Bounce
Shinespark Midair
strats.note: Spark through the top of the door to avoid the platforms.
strats.devNote: FIXME: Add strats that come in charged and spark to save energy.

strats.name: Blue SpaceJump, Into the Room
strats.note: Jump Immediately upon entry, or before the transition.
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Rinka or Metroid
note: Use a frozen Metroid or a Rinka from the left to extend the length of the runway.
Luring a Rinka is easiest with Morph - While morphed, barely move the bottom Rinka spawner on camera in order to have it shoot at a usable angle.
Without Morph, use the top Rinka spawner and jump just before the Rinka starts moving to get a usable angle.

strats.name: Tank and PB Kill
note: Place Power Bombs to kill the Metroids.
By hitting the first Rinka, all of the Metroids (on a similar vertical height to the Power Bomb) will be damaged.
strats.devNote: Using 1 pack of PBs isn't intuitive as a way to kill 4 metroids without grouping them.

strats.name: Metroid Room 1 PB Dodge Kill (Right to Left)
note: Group all of the Metroids by hitting the first Rinka with a Power Bomb.
Once grouped, use two more Power Bombs to finish them off.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Rinka
note: Wait for the Rinka to spawn, then jump, so the trajectory is as high as possible. Space jump makes this a bit easier.
If the Metroids are alive, lure them off screen to the left.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Metroid
G-Mode Morph Power Bomb Metroid Kill
note: Kill the Metroids while artificially morphed with just Spring Ball to avoid them.
A Metroid (or a Rinka) must be completely on screen while a Power Bomb explodes in order for it to lure the other Metroids.
Because of this, with extra ammo, it is possible to kill one of them before luring the rest.
In general, this seems to be easiest by minimizing Samus's horizontal movement as much as possible and getting the Metroids in sync with each other while circling around her.
While moving horizontally, their movement is less predictable and harder to sync.
Note that it is necessary to exit G-Mode before exiting the room in order for the Metroids to remain killed.
strats.devNote: It is occasionally possible with just 3 Power Bombs, which doesn't make sense since the first one doesn't hit all of the Metroids.

strats.name: Speedjump
strats.note: Use the full runway to gain blue speed and enough speed to reach the far platform.

strats.name: Metroid Room 1 Spring Ball Bounce (Left to Right)
note: At max run speed without SpeedBooster, you can bounce on both platforms and avoid all acid.
Jump from the center of the rightmost X in the background.
Bounce again on the second platform to avoid any Metroid or Rinkas.
strats.devNote: Just doing the strat avoids almost all damage, so Screw attack and metroidframes values are mostly artificial.

strats.name: Frozen Enemy (Left to Right)
note: Freeze the middle Metroid as soon as it comes on screen to use as a platform to cross over the acid.
If no Metroids are alive, the far left Rinka can be used instead, at a high angle.
The left Rinka can also just be used to setup an angle with the Rinka near the left edge of the pool.

strats.name: Metroid Room 1 Rinka Boost (Left to Right)
note: Aim the leftmost Rinka to travel horizontally across the top of the room and use it to damage boost between the two floating platforms.
Killing the Rinka will normalize it's respawn timer, which may help in setting up the correct angle.
Let the Rinka stay far enough ahead of Samus that she can jump the full distance to the first platform without hitting it.
And then once it has reached the right edge of the platform, use it to damage boost.

strats.name: Acid Run
strats.note: SpinJump often to reduce the amount of time spent in the acid.

strats.name: Acid Bounce Ball
note: Jump from the left platform and mid air morph to bounce through the lava quickly.
This is only useful when morphing before reaching the ceiling.
strats.devNote: Freezing a Metroid while exiting the acid is difficult but manageable.

strats.name: Bomb Jump
strats.note: Bomb Jump between the two floating platforms.

strats.name: Spring Ball Bounce (Right to Left)
note: At max non-speed run speed, Spring Ball bounce on both platforms and avoid all acid.
Land on the right side of the first platform to avoid the second Metroid.
Bouncing on the second platform will usually avoid the third Metroid.

strats.name: Frozen Rinka (Right to Left)
note: Use the lower Rinka as a platform to setup the angle for the top Rinka.
Then use the frozen Rinka to cross the acid.

strats.name: Metroid Room 1 Rinka Boost (Right to Left)
note: Aim the ceiling Rinka to travel horizontally across the top of the room and use it to damage boost between the two floating platforms.

Killing the lower Rinka shortly before killing the higher Rinka will synchronize their respawn timers so that Samus can jump when the lower Rinka reappears in order to get a good angle on the higher Rinka.
Jump to the floating platform ahead of the high Rinka, jumping extra high to lead the Metroid out of the way if it is alive.
Jump into the Rinka once it reaches the left edge of the platform to reach the next platform.
Then use I-frames to pass through the Metroid if it is still alive.

strats.name: Fearless Dive
devNote: 1) Jump from the acid to the floating platform.
2) Deal with the Metroid.
3) Jump from the platform to the ledge, potentially falling in acid.

strats.name: Infinite Bomb Jump
strats.note: Bomb Jump between the two floating platforms.

strats.name: Use Flash Suit
note: While on the first platform, perform a long jump to the left then diagonally spark low into the side of the next platform.
This will put Samus into a position where the Metroid will swoop underneath her.
strats.devNote: This is only useful with a flash suit without Speed Booster.

devNote: Doing 'canMetroidAvoid' while using the runway below the left door (e.g. to get a shinecharge) seems pretty tough; maybe it should require something more?

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Rinka
note: Kill or lure and freeze the Metroids at the bottom of the room.
It may be easiest to stand on a frozen Rinka from the top left spawner to position a freeze of the other Rinka.
Maintain a half-tile gap between the Rinka and the runway in order to extend it as far as possible.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Rinka
G-Mode Morph Power Bomb Metroid Kill
note: This is easiest by staying on the top floating platform with the two Metroids stuck below it.
Note that it is necessary to exit G-Mode before exiting the room in order for the Metroids to remain killed.

strats.name: Metroid Room 2 PB Dodge Kill
strats.note: An easy way is once Samus is on the top platform, jump and aim down to lower the camera, then place 3 PBs.

strats.name: Screw Evade
note: Use ScrewAttack or a PseudoScrew to prevent Metroids from attaching to Samus.

strats.name: Come In Shinecharging, Leave With Spark (Long Way Around)
Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Long Way Around)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
strats.note: Use X-ray immediately after shinecharging, in order to be able to dodge the Rinkas.
strats.devNote: Doing this with Metroids alive is technically possible but seems really bad.

strats.name: Metroid Room 2 PB Dodge Kill (Bottom to Top)
strats.note: Kill the two Metroids with Power Bombs while avoiding damage.

strats.name: Screw Evade
strats.note: Use ScrewAttack or a PseudoScrew to prevent Metroids from attaching to Samus.

strats.name: Metroid Room 2 Bottom Door Metroid Avoid
note: Buffer a spinjump towards the door to jump over the top metroid and land on the middle platform.
Metroids can be knocked with Beam shots to clear a path.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb With Immobile
note: Enter immobile with G-mode direct, with the Metroids having been killed previously.
Take a Rinka hit to regain mobility.
Back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 1 screen, moving quickly to minimize Rinka damage.
Perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.
devNote: The 'immobile' requirement in the entranceCondition is not necessary but is included for clarity.
Without coming in immobile, it would not be possible to have enough energy to survive the Rinka hit.
The enemyDamage in this strat is for a second Rinka hit while climbing.
The first Rinka hit is included in the gModeImmobile requirement.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb With Ice
note: Enter with G-mode direct, and quickly freeze the Metroids (if still alive) and Rinkas.
Back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 1 screen, moving quickly to avoid Rinka damage.
Perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb With Crystal Flash
note: Enter with G-mode direct, using artificial morph to avoid the Metroids if they are still alive.
Go to the top of the room and Crystal Flash, with the Metroids stuck below (if alive).
The Crystal Flash will leave behind a light orb, which can be used to kill the Metroids.
Use the Rinkas to damage down.
For the final hit that will trigger auto-reserves, stand in the open doorway between 1 and 6 pixels from the transition.
The auto reserve trigger will cancel G-mode and close the door on top of Samus.
Climb up 1 screen, moving quickly to minimize Rinka damage.
Perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Spark (Left Side)
note: Not pressing dash will make the platforming easier, unless HiJump is also equipped.
strats.devNote: Metroids randomly block shots fired and can make opening the door unreliable.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (HiJump)
note: Spinjump into the opening below the top door.
strats.devNote: Metroids randomly block shots fired and can make opening the door unreliable.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Morph)
note: Wall jump up the right wall and either mid-air morph to fit through the gap below the top door.
Alternatively use a mid-air wiggle to reduce the height of Samus' hitbox after the walljump, to be able to fit through the gap without morphing.
strats.devNote: Metroids randomly block shots fired and can make opening the door unreliable.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Wiggle)
note: Use a mid-air wiggle to reduce the height of Samus' hitbox after the walljump, to be able to fit through the gap without morphing.
strats.devNote: Metroids randomly block shots fired and can make opening the door unreliable.

strats.name: Carry Shinecharge (HiJump)
note: Spinjump into the opening below the top door.

strats.name: Carry Shinecharge (Morph)
note: Wall jump up the right wall and either mid-air morph to fit through the gap below the top door.
Alternatively use a mid-air wiggle to reduce the height of Samus' hitbox after the walljump, to be able to fit through the gap without morphing.

strats.name: Carry Shinecharge (Wiggle)
note: Wall jump up the right wall and use a mid-air wiggle to reduce the height of Samus' hitbox after the walljump, to be able to fit through the gap without morphing.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (HiJump)
note: Spinjump into the opening below the top door.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Morph)
note: Wall jump up the right wall and either mid-air morph to fit through the gap below the top door.
Alternatively use a mid-air wiggle to reduce the height of Samus' hitbox after the walljump, to be able to fit through the gap without morphing.
Shoot the door open and spark out.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Wiggle)
note: Wall jump up the right wall and use a mid-air wiggle to reduce the height of Samus' hitbox after the walljump, to be able to fit through the gap without morphing.
Shoot the door open and spark out.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
strats.note: Use X-ray immediately after shinecharging, in order to be able to dodge the Rinkas.

strats.name: Leave with Runway
strats.devNote: FIXME: Is it worth adding a method with avoiding the Metroids?

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Rinka
note: Kill or lure and freeze the Metroids at the top of the room.
It may be easiest to stand on a frozen Rinka from the left spawner to position a freeze of the other Rinka.
It is possible maintain a half-tile gap between the Rinka and the runway in order to extend it as far as possible.

strats.name: Leave With Mockball
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable landing tile here; at low speeds (earlier jump) it could be used but wouldn't serve a purpose.

strats.name: Crystal Flash
note: To avoid heavy Rinka damage, you must perform the Crystal Flash on a specific tile: on the third floor tile from the left wall.
Lay the Power Bomb immediately after destroying both Rinkas.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Rinka
note: If the Metroids are alive, lure them off screen.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Metroid
G-Mode Regain Mobility
strats.note: If alive, the Metroids do 90 damage before the Rinka hits.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb Metroid Kill
note: Quickly artificial morph and roll off to the bottom before being grabbed by the Metroids.
This is much easier in indirect artificial morph.
Note that it is necessary to exit G-Mode before exiting the room in order for the Metroids to remain killed.
strats.devNote: FIXME: This can be done in immobile, but probably never matters, since it will require so much energy.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Rinka
note: One simple setup to position a Rinka is to crouch a couple tiles away from the bottom right spawner.
This will also prevent the left two Rinka spawners to activate, as they will be off camera.
It is possible maintain a half-tile gap between the Rinka and the runway in order to extend it as far as possible.
strats.devNote: FIXME: It is possible but challenging to set up a frozen Rinka on the right door.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Short Runway)
Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Long Runway)
G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Rinka
G-Mode Morph Power Bomb Metroid Kill
note: Kill the Metroids while artificially morphed with just Spring Ball to avoid them.
A Metroid (or a Rinka) must be completely on screen while a Power Bomb explodes in order for it to lure the other Metroids.
One strategy for this location is to wait for the Rinkas to fire twice, then place a Power Bomb in the hallway to the right and return to lure one.
Jump over it twice and at the top of the second jump place a second Power Bomb; this one will explode when the other two Metroids arrive.
Jumping high to the right can also help get them stuck in the top right corner while placing a Power Bomb.
Note that it is necessary to exit G-Mode before exiting the room in order for the Metroids to remain killed.
strats.devNote: It is occasionally possible with just 3 Power Bombs, which doesn't make sense since the first one doesn't hit all of the Metroids.

strats.name: Tank and PB Kill
note: Place Power Bombs to kill the Metroids.
By hitting the first Rinka, all of the Metroids (on a similar vertical height to the Power Bomb) will be damaged.
strats.devNote: Using 1 pack of PBs isn't intuitive as a way to kill 3 metroids without grouping them.

strats.name: 3 PB Dodge Kill (Left to Right)
note: Group the Metroids by hitting the first Rinka with a Power Bomb.
Quickly moving to the right as the Power Bomb explodes may help as that area is more open with no Rinkas.
Then Kill all three Metroids with Power Bombs while avoiding damage.

strats.name: Screw Evade
note: Use ScrewAttack or a PseudoScrew to prevent Metroids from attaching to Samus.
These abilities may also be used to temporarily prevent damage from Metroids if they do attach.

strats.name: Blue SpaceJump, Into the Room
strats.note: Jump Immediately upon entry, or before the transition.
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.devNote: FIXME: Add strats that come in charged and spark to save energy.

strats.name: Tank and PB Kill
note: Place Power Bombs to kill the Metroids.
By hitting the first Rinka, all of the Metroids (on a similar vertical height to the Power Bomb) will be damaged.
devNote: Using 1 pack of PBs isn't intuitive as a way to kill 3 metroids without grouping them.
Killing the first Metroid happens to group the other two nearby, and when jumping close to them they derp around.

strats.name: PB Dodge Kill (Right Side)
note: Group the Metroids by hitting the first Rinka with a Power Bomb.
Then Kill all three Metroids with Power Bombs while avoiding damage.

strats.name: Screw Evade
note: Use ScrewAttack or a PseudoScrew to prevent Metroids from attaching to Samus.
These abilities may also be used to temporarily prevent damage from Metroids if they do attach.

strats.name: Blue SpaceJump, Into the Room
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.devNote: FIXME: Add strats that come in charged and spark to save energy.

strats.name: Leave With Controlled Spring Ball Bounce
Crystal Flash
note: Be at a safe distance from Rinkas before performing the Crystal Flash.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Rinka
G-Mode Morph Power Bomb Metroid Kill
note: Kill the Metroids while artificially morphed with just Spring Ball to avoid them.
A Metroid (or a Rinka) must be completely on screen while a Power Bomb explodes in order for it to lure the other Metroids.
Start the room with a bomb boost spring ball jump or a precise horizontal bomb boost.
In general, this seems to be easiest by minimizing Samus's horizontal movement as much as possible and getting the Metroids in sync with each other while circling around her.
While moving horizontally, their movement is less predictable and harder to sync.
Note that it is necessary to exit G-Mode before exiting the room in order for the Metroids to remain killed.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Rinka
note: Kill or lure and freeze the Metroid down lower in the room off camera.
One simple setup to position a Rinka is to stand or crouch a couple tiles away from the edge of the runway and freeze the Rinka from the right spawner.
It is possible maintain a half-tile gap between the Rinka and the runway in order to extend it as far as possible.

strats.name: Crystal Flash
note: To avoid heavy Rinka damage, perform the Crystal Flash while backed against the left door or inside the open door frame.
Lay the Power Bomb immediately after destroying the Rinka with the closer spawn location.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Rinka
G-Mode Morph Power Bomb Metroid Kill
note: Kill the Metroids while artificially morphed without any movement items.
With just 5 Power Bombs, place one on the first platform to kill some Rinkas and to lure a second Metroid.
Place a second in the same region, then drop down and quickly place a third on the second platform and fall to the third platform while the first two Metroids die.
The remaining two Power Bombs can safely placed here to kill the final Metroid.
Note that it is necessary to exit G-Mode before exiting the room in order for the Metroids to remain killed.
strats.devNote: FIXME: It may be possible to kill the Metroids starting at the bottom door.

strats.name: Metroid Room 4 Safe Six PB Kill
Metroid Room 4 Three PB Kill (Top to Bottom)
note: Group the Metroids by descending the room.
Then Kill all three Metroids with Power Bombs while avoiding damage.

strats.name: Harder Evade
strats.note: Run under the top Metroid then roll beneath the second and third.

strats.name: Metroid Room 4 Top Metroid Avoid
note: Avoid all of the Rinkas and Metroids with no equipment and taking no damage.
One way to do this is to bait the top Rinkas to fire upwards, and then carefully spinjump around each corner as the Metroid below passes by.

strats.name: Tank the Damage
strats.note: Taking a rinka hit stops the Metroid damage for a while and is less damage.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
note: Use X-ray immediately after shinecharging, in order to be able to dodge the Rinkas.
Use spring ball to bounce through the 3-tile-high portion.
devNote: It might technically be possible to get through the 3-tile-high part without Spring Ball, but this probably isn't really viable?

strats.name: Tank and Three PB Kill
note: Climb to the middle section and kill all three Metroids while taking damage.
Or use a tricky jump morph into the bottom left corner of room to kill all three Metroids from the bottom section.

strats.name: Tank and Six PB Kill
strats.note: Move to the middle section after the first Metroid has died to kill the remaining two.

strats.name: Metroid Room 4 Bottom Metroid Avoid (Six PB Dodge Kill)
note: Take out the lower two Metroids with Power Bombs while avoiding damage.
Then Kill the remaining one with three more Power Bombs.

strats.name: Metroid Room 4 Bottom Metroid Avoid (Three PB Dodge Kill)
note: Move to the left side of the lowest section and jump morph before placing the Power Bomb to kill all three Metroids.
Then Kill all three Metroids with Power Bombs while avoiding damage.

strats.name: Metroid Room 4 Bottom Metroid Avoid (Traverse Room)
note: Avoid all of the Rinkas and Metroids with no equipment and taking no damage.
Begin by shooting the bottom Metroid hold it in place, and wait right below the first ledge.
Once the middle Metroid passes by, jump up and shoot any Rinkas that are in the way.
Repeat for the next ledge, clear any Rinkas, and then run to the door.

strats.name: Tank the Damage
strats.note: Taking a rinka hit stops the Metroid damage for a while and is less damage.
strats.devNote: Avoiding Rinkas is more difficult than getting hit, so it is not important to know to want to get hit.

strats.name: Shinespark
devNote: This strat is not useful in-room, but can satisfy a strat in the room before with an exit shinespark.
This requires the Metroids to be killed, because otherwise Samus will be grabbed on entry, and the other 2->1 strats won't work.

strats.name: G-Mode Regain Mobility
strats.note: If alive, the Metroids do up to 78 damage before the Rinka hits. Entering through the middle of the door will require less damage.

230.name: Blue Hopper Room

strats.name: Leave With Platform Below
strats.devNote: Additional platforms could be added, but they don't yet appear to have applications.

strats.name: Carry G-Mode Morph Back Up
strats.devNote: FIXME: This could be possible with Bombs by luring the hoppers to the left.

strats.name: Carry G-Mode Morph Back Up, Spring Ball Bomb Jump
strats.note: Immediately on entry Spring Ball Bomb Jump. Be sure not to land left of the pillar below the door or it is harder to get up in time.
strats.devNote: FIXME: This could be possible with Bombs by luring the hoppers to the left.

strats.name: Blue Hopper Dodge (Normal Entry)
note: Enter through the far left side of the door.
Wait for the top hopper to move right to start running.
Run under the right Hopper and jump over the left Hopper to avoid all damage.
Jump when Samus reaches the leftmost lump in the ground to avoid the left hopper.
It helps to keep the camera scrolled to the right.

strats.name: Blue Hopper Dodge (Toilet Entry)
note: Try to scroll the camera to the right to keep the left Hopper off-camera for longer.
Wait for the top hopper to move right to start running.
Run under the right Hopper and jump over the left Hopper to avoid all damage.
Jump when Samus reaches the leftmost lump in the ground to avoid the left hopper.

strats.name: Screw Attack
note: Wait for the top hopper to move right, then jump through the left hopper.
The left hopper may be harder to dodge if the camera is scrolled to the left.

strats.name: Kill the Enemies
note: Kill the top hopper quickly; the left hopper is more random.
To be safe, plan to retreat right while attacking.
It also helps to attempt to move the hopper off camera between attacks.

strats.name: Kill the Enemies, Leave With Runway
note: Kill the top hopper quickly; the left hopper is more random.
To be safe, plan to retreat right while attacking.
It also helps to attempt to move the hopper off camera between attacks.
devNote: FIXME: An alternative strat may be possible where the enemies are lured off-camera to the right instead of killed.

strats.name: Kill the Enemies, Leave Spinning
strats.devNote: Defining an obstacle for the enemies could help simplify these strats.

strats.name: Kill the Enemies, Leave With Mockball
Kill the Enemies, Leave With Spring Ball Bounce
Kill the Enemies, Leave Space Jumping
strats.note: For higher speed, use the farther-away runway in the middle of the room.

strats.name: Take the Damage
note: Wait for the left hopper to move right so it does not follow Samus as IFrames run out.
A damage boost using the top hopper also moves through the room fast enough to be safe.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Prepared Dodge
strats.devNote: FIXME: add a Toilet entry version of this

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Tank the Damage)
Blue Hopper Room Screw Attack Jumps
note: Spin jump into the room with Screw Attack, holding left through the transition to land near the door.
Do a turn-around spin jump to the right, bonking the ceiling and overhang and then falling straight down.
Then run and spin jump to the right through the Hoppers, to make it to the door without taking damage.

strats.name: Blue Hopper Room Roll Under Hoppers
note: Time Samus' movement carefully to roll underneath a Blue Hopper and also race it to the far door.
Enter the room morphed and let the hoppers jump against the wall a couple of times.
After the lower hopper has long enough time between jumps, roll under and run to the door.

strats.name: Blue Hopper Room Squeeze Under Hoppers
note: Use at least 4 tiles of runway to gain speed, running through the transition.
Hold down during and after the transition in order to aim down and squeeze under the Hopper.
Then immediately run to the right to make it to the door without taking damage.

strats.name: Kill Hopper
note: Enter the room in ball mode and let the hoppers jump against the wall a couple of times.
Between hops, unmorph and shoot the lower hopper.
Roll under the top hopper until it goes off camera to the left.

strats.name: Blue Speed Jump through Hoppers
strats.note: Jump far enough to land on the first floor pillar.
strats.devNote: This is not the level of precision that would call for canBlueSpaceJump.

strats.name: Tourian Blue Hopper Crystal Flash
note: Enter the room from the left door, morph, and wait at the left wall.
After 6 hops, the bottom Hopper will do three big hops in a row.
Roll under the Hopper while it does the third of those three big hops.
Quickly unmorph and run to the right side of the room.
If successful, both Hoppers will remain off-camera, so you can safely Crystal Flash.

strats.name: Sidehopper Prepared Morph Dodge
note: Enter the room morphed to avoid a hopper hit on entry.
Roll under the bottom hopper to lead it to the right, and then roll back to reach the door safely.

strats.name: Sidehopper Prepared Morph Dodge Hopper Kill
strats.note: Enter the room morphed to avoid a hopper hit on entry.

devNote: FIXME: This room could use obstacles indicating if each door is free of hoppers, allowing opening the door with missiles or a power bomb.
and to ensure hoppers are still alive to use for G-Mode setups.

to.note: The baby event happens every time you enter from the right

strats.name: Enter From Left
strats.note: The Baby Metroid is not active when entering from the left side of the room.

strats.name: Leave with Runway, Extended Seaweed Runway
Leave With Spark
note: Gain a shinecharge by running right-to-left on the leftmost runway.
Then run toward the right, jumping twice before sparking mid-air.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Space Jump)
Leave With Controlled Spring Ball Bounce
Classic Baby Skip
note: Jump over the Baby Metroid to avoid getting grabbed.
Use Wave plus a Wide Beam to clear much of the seaweed with each shot.
The classic counter clockwise skip ends with a mid air morph into the transition.
strats.devNote: A wide beam is used to avoid picking off stray seaweeds since that is a skill used in waveless skip.

strats.name: Baby Skip Without Wave or Speed
strats.note: Avoid the Baby Metroid by jumping over it many times in order to clear a path through the seaweed.

strats.name: Baby Skip With Nothing
note: Avoid the Baby Metroid with no items at all.
Jump over it many times in order to clear a path through the seaweed.
With a counter clockwise setup, stand as close to the transition as possible while allowing the Baby to circle Samus.
Then jump towards the transition and touch it with a walljump check.
A clockwise setup is more difficult to clear the seaweed, but can jump directly into the transition.
devNote: FIXME: Add a Baby Skip with a flash suit. Note, however, it will only pair with rooms that have an entrance condition where Samus is sparking.
In order to have it be properly implemented, all horizontal doors will need to have a shinespark entrance condition added.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Space Jump)
Leave with Runway, Extended Seaweed Runway
strats.note: If coming from below, carefully get up on the left side of the room without breaking the runway blocks.

strats.name: Leave With Mockball
devNote: There is one unusable remote runway tile here, in order to allow space to reasonably perform the mockball.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce
devNote: There is one unusable remote runway tile here, in order to allow space to reasonably perform the bounce.

strats.name: Crystal Flash
strats.devNote: If it is needed to use one of the extended runways, then the Crystal Flash can be performed on the opposite side of the room from the needed runway.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Spark (Wave)
strats.note: Use Wave to clear the seaweed quickly.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
strats.note: Carefully clear a path through the seaweed in order to chain temporary blue up or down the room.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
strats.note: Carefully clear a path through the seaweed in order to chain temporary blue up or down the room.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Wave or Spazer)
strats.note: Use Wave or Spazer to clear the seaweed quickly.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Missiles)
strats.note: Use Missiles to clear the seaweed quickly.
strats.devNote: It may be possible to use fewer Missiles by switching weapons.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Spark
strats.note: Clear the seaweed one block at a time, with just barely enough time remaining to spark out the door.

strats.name: Carry Shinecharge (Wave)
strats.note: Use Wave to clear the seaweed quickly.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave with Spark (Wave)
strats.note: Use Wave to clear the seaweed quickly.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
strats.note: Carefully clear a path through the seaweed in order to chain temporary blue up or down the room.

strats.name: Leave with Runway, Extended Seaweed Runway
Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Wave)
note: Gain a shinecharge while entering the room.
Hold run and forward to stand up and press against the seaweed.
Then fire a Wave shot to clear the seaweed and open the door, and run and jump across the room.
If you fire the Wave shot too early (while having forward momentum), it will shoot too high and not break the blocks at Samus' knees.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave with Spark
note: Gain a shinecharge while entering the room.
Angle down to shoot the first seaweed block at the level of Samus' knees.
Take four tiny steps forward, firing a shot with forward momentum on each step, destroying the seaweed at the level of Samus' head, with the last shot continuing on to open the door.
Do one more angle down shot to destroy the last seaweed block at Samus' knees.
To minimize energy usage, jump across the room before shinesparking through the door.

strats.name: Carry Shinecharge (Wave)
strats.note: Use Wave to clear the seaweed quickly.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave with Spark
note: Angle down to shoot the first seaweed block at the level of Samus' knees.
Take four tiny steps forward, firing a shot with forward momentum on each step, destroying the seaweed at the level of Samus' head, with the last shot continuing on to open the door.
Do one more angle down shot to destroy the last seaweed block at Samus' knees.
Then shinespark through the door.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (HiJump Wall Jump)
Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Wall Jump)
Carry Shinecharge (Wave)
strats.note: Use single well-timed Wave shot to clear the seaweed quickly.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave with Spark (Wave)
note: Use single well-timed Wave shot to clear the seaweed quickly.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave with Spark
note: Use five shots to destroy the seaweed blocks:
Buffer the first shot while entering the room.
Spin jump for the second shot (landing on the slightly raised platform), firing at an intermediate height in order to destroy two blocks.
Fire two shots while standing on the platform.
Spin jump for the final shot, and activate the shinespark mid-air.

strats.name: 10 Power Bomb Crystal Flash
strats.note: In quick succession, place a Power Bomb, refill at the refill station, then morph and Crystal Flash.
devNote: This strat does not work in vanilla, and only works if Missile refill stations also refill Supers and Power Bombs
This is applicable in this room because this also refills Reserve Tanks, unlike the Energy refill station.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Space Jump)
Leave With Controlled Spring Ball Bounce
G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Rinka
note: Lure a Rinka to the top door without letting it go off screen.
The bottom right Rinka can be lured at the correct angle by standing on the central platform then jumping slightly before it moves.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 1 screen, moving quickly to avoid Rinka hits, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Hi Jump Wall Jump)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Hi Jump Platforming)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Wall Jump)
Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (HiJump Platforming)
Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Wall Jump)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Platforming)
Leave With Runway - Frozen Rinka
note: One simple setup to position a Rinka is to stand a few pixels away from the right edge of the floating platform in front of the door.
The lower right Rinka spawner will spawn a Rinka at a good angle.
It is possible maintain a half-tile gap between the Rinka and the runway in order to extend it as far as possible.
strats.devNote: FIXME: It is possible but challenging to set up a frozen Rinka at the top door by walking off of the small platform on the right side of the room.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Rinka
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb With Immobile
note: Enter immobile with G-mode direct, taking a Rinka hit to regain mobility.
Back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 2 screens, moving quickly to minimize Rinka damage.
Perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.
devNote: The 'immobile' requirement in the entranceCondition is not necessary but is included for clarity.
Without coming in immobile, it would not be possible to have enough energy to survive the Rinka hit.
The enemyDamage in this strat is for a second Rinka hit while climbing.
The first Rinka hit is included in the gModeImmobile requirement.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb With Ice
note: Enter with G-mode direct, and freeze the bottom Rinka near the door.
Back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 2 screens, moving quickly to avoid Rinka damage.
Perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb With Crystal Flash
note: Enter with G-mode direct, and go to the top of the room to perform a Crystal Flash to refill on energy without destroying all the bottom Rinkas.
Use the Rinkas to damage down.
For the final hit that will trigger auto-reserves, stand in the open doorway between 1 and 6 pixels from the transition.
The auto reserve trigger will cancel G-mode and close the door on top of Samus.
Climb up 2 screens, moving quickly to minimize Rinka damage.
Perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (HiJump Wall Jump)
Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (HiJump Platforming)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
strats.note: Use X-ray immediately after shinecharging, in order to be able to dodge the Rinkas.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb With Immobile
note: Enter immobile with G-mode direct, taking a Rinka hit to regain mobility.
Back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 1 screen, moving quickly to minimize Rinka damage.
Perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.
devNote: The 'immobile' requirement in the entranceCondition is not necessary but is included for clarity.
Without coming in immobile, it would not be possible to have enough energy to survive the Rinka hit.
The enemyDamage in this strat is for a second Rinka hit while climbing.
The first Rinka hit is included in the gModeImmobile requirement.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb With Ice
note: Enter with G-mode direct, and freeze the bottom Rinka near the door.
Back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 1 screen, moving quickly to avoid Rinka damage.
Perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb With Crystal Flash
note: Enter with G-mode direct, and go to the top of the room to perform a Crystal Flash to refill on energy without destroying all the bottom Rinkas.
Use a Rinka to damage down.
For the final hit that will trigger auto-reserves, stand in the open doorway between 1 and 6 pixels from the transition.
The auto reserve trigger will cancel G-mode and close the door on top of Samus.
Climb up 1 screen, moving quickly to minimize Rinka damage.
Perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Full Runway, HiJump Wall Jump)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Full Runway, HiJump Platforming)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Spark (Full Runway, Platforming)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Short Runway, HiJump Wall Jump)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Short Runway, Wall Jump)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Short Runway, HiJump Platforming)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Short Runway, Platforming)
Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Hi Jump Wall Jump)
Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Hi Jump)
Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Wall Jump)
Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Platforming)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
strats.note: Use X-ray immediately after shinecharging, in order to be able to dodge the Rinkas.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Rinka

238.name: Mother Brain Room
devNote: FIXME: Maybe we can split MB into several events to properly indicate the ammo requirements?
FIXME: It is possible toGrapple teleport from Moat to the left of Mother Brain, through currently it has no known use.

nodes.name: Mother Brain
devNote: Requires 18 ammo to fully break the glass, which will remain broken if Samus leaves.
Or, it takes 6 ammo to partially break the glass, and then 3000 damage is required to kill Mother Brain 1, but the glass also needs to be broken.
The requirements for finishing Mother Brain 1 is in the 3 to 4 link.

to.note: Direct link to Mother Brain 1 for the Speed Zebetite skip.

note: Glass takes 18 hits of any missile and must be killed to win the fight while MB1 itself requires 3000 hp worth of ammo after the initial 6 hits opens the hole.
Each hit on MB also damages glass, counting for one of the 18 hits for that.

to.note: This door appears only after Mother Brain is defeated. Because Mother Brain 3 requires practically nothing, events move directly from MB2 to defeat
Direct link to Mother Brain 1 for the Ice Zebetite skip.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Rinka
Carry G-Mode Morph Back Through
strats.devNote: FIXME: This is possible with an IBJ with a PB, and maybe without, but it's challenging.

strats.name: Leave with Runway
strats.note: Carefully dodge the Rinkas, or take a hit, while carefully avoiding falling off, then use the I-Frames to use the runway.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Rinka or Turret Shot
Mother Brain Speed Zebetite Skip (Come in Shinecharging)
note: Shinespark diagonally into the lower Rinka Spawner while holding down, spamming jump, then pressing forward,
in order to glitch through the first Mother Brain Zebetites during Samus' i-frames.
The remaining Zebetites will not spawn.
strats.devNote: This technically requires f_KilledZebetites1 to not be set, but there is no loss of access, because there is no reason to kill any Zebs without being able to kill them all.

strats.name: Mother Brain Speed Zebetite Skip (Come in Shinecharged)
note: Shinespark diagonally into the lower Rinka Spawner while holding down, spamming jump, then pressing forward,
in order to glitch through the first Mother Brain Zebetites during Samus' i-frames.
The remaining Zebetites will not spawn.
strats.devNote: This technically requires f_KilledZebetites1 to not be set, but there is no loss of access, because there is no reason to kill any Zebs without being able to kill them all.

strats.name: Mother Brain Speed Zebetite Skip (Use Flash Suit)
note: Shinespark diagonally into the lower Rinka Spawner while holding down, spamming jump, then pressing forward,
in order to glitch through the first Mother Brain Zebetites during Samus' i-frames.
The remaining Zebetites will not spawn.
strats.devNote: This technically requires f_KilledZebetites1 to not be set, but there is no loss of access, because there is no reason to kill any Zebs without being able to kill them all.

strats.name: Mother Brain R-Mode Reduced Tanks
note: After entering with R-mode, perform a Crystal Flash to fully refill at some point before the rainbow beam attack.
An R-Mode forced stand-up will happen during the rainbow beam attack, slightly reducing the damage taken which allows surviving with one fewer tank than normal.

strats.name: Mother Brain R-Mode Light Pillar
note: After entering with R-mode, perform a Crystal Flash to fully refill at some point before the rainbow beam attack.
When Mother Brain is about to do the rainbow beam attack, set up a 'light pillar':
this is done by using X-Ray, deselecting X-Ray while continuing to hold dash, then briefly releasing dash for one or two frames before repressing dash.
During the rainbow beam attack, release dash while the auto-reserve refill is happening.

strats.name: Mother Brain Ice Zebetite Skip
note: Glitch through the Mother Brain Zebetites by using a frozen Rinka and i-frames.
Freeze the Rinka at its spawn location, then spinjump or Down-Back onto it after acquiring i-frames to clip inside of the Zebetite, then jump through.
Note that Zebetites cause i-frames but deal no damage.
Ice+Wave can freeze the Rinka from above.  Ice+Plasma must freeze the Rinka from below while crouched.
devNote: This technically requires f_KilledZebetites1 to not be set, but there is no loss of access, because there is no reason to kill any Zebs without being able to kill them all.
It is possible to Ice Zeb skip through the second Zeb with a morph/unmorph/remorph on a frozen Rinka.
This is known as a Remorph Zebetite Skip or a Spring Ball Zebetite Skip.
FIXME: It is possible to Ice Zeb Skip out, but it is much harder and would only be useful if getting here with canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess.

nodes.name: Right Doorway
nodes.note: It's really just a wall. You can't go back.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged
devNote: It is possible to run in from the right while shooting the first gate, then quickly leave charged through the bottom door,
but it's not really easier than a 21 tile Shinecharge.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.devNote: This strat is not useful in-room, but can satisfy a strat in the room before with an exit shinespark.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
Carry Shinecharge (HiJump, Screw, Wall Jump)
note: Enter shinecharged with a spin-jump.
Perform quick ledge-grabs to reach the top of the room and spark out.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Ledge Grabs)
note: Enter shinecharged with a spin-jump.
Perform quick ledge-grabs to reach the top of the room and spark out.

strats.name: Leave With Mockball
strats.note: Use the floating platform near the bottom-left of the room.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce
strats.note: Use the floating platform near the bottom-left of the room.

strats.name: Leave Space Jumping
strats.note: Use the floating platform near the bottom-left of the room.

strats.name: Leave Spinning
strats.note: Use the lower runway.

strats.name: Leave With Mockball
strats.note: Use the lower runway.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce
strats.note: Use the upper runway.

strats.name: Leave Space Jumping
strats.note: Use the upper runway.

strats.name: Kill Pirates Quickly
strats.note: Kill the Pirates fast enough that they won't attack, or shoot them from below with Wave.
strats.devNote: These requirements are to kill all of the pirates, but another strat is needed to cross the room to get to the top half.

strats.name: Kill Pirates Slowly
note: Run from or Roll under the pirate lasers.
The Pirates will also not shoot if they come on screen while Samus is crouched.
strats.devNote: These requirements are to kill all of the pirates, but another strat is needed to cross the room to get to the top half.

strats.name: Pass Through Pirates
note: Safely kill the first pirate, then walk through the rest while taking damage or by using Plasma Beam.
It is possible to get through the lower three pirates with a single hit while using i-frames to prevent a second hit.
Either go below the pirates and use the camera to manipulate them to be closer together,
or arm-pump or horizontal damage boost to get through them fast enough.

strats.name: SpeedBooster
note: Run into the pirates with speedbooster to save health over shinesparking.
A speedy jump can reach the top platform.

strats.name: Use Flash Suit
strats.note: With the pirates killed, Samus can spark up near the center of the room to save Energy.

strats.name: Use Flash Suit, Through the Speed Blocks
strats.devNote: With low Energy, Samus will also avoid the Pirate laser, but that is not modeled.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph PB Pirate Kill
strats.note: IBJ or spring ball bomb jump to avoid the wall jump. The first pirate takes 2 PBs, the next 3 can be killed with 3 total PBs if they are placed under the middle pirate.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph PB Pirate Hitbox
strats.note: IBJ or spring ball bomb jump to avoid the wall jump. Using a total of 3 PBs will allow Samus to roll through the bottom 4 pirates.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Pirate Tank
strats.note: Tank 3 pirate hits then IBJ or spring ball bomb jump to avoid the wall jump.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload Speed Blocks
strats.note: Take the bottom path and place many bombs near the speed blocks to overload PLMs and go through them.

strats.name: Pass Through Pirates
strats.note: Walk through the pirates either by taking damage or by using Plasma Beam.

strats.name: SpeedBooster
strats.note: Fall through the speed blocks from above with Temporary Blue, or kill the pirates from above with speed echoes.

strats.name: Fight Pirates Slowly
note: Run from or Roll under the pirate lasers.
The Pirates will also not shoot if they come on screen while Samus is crouched.
devNote: Technically it's not possible to kill the bottom Pirates while staying at node 2 (not dropping down);
but if we're not going down, then it doesn't matter that the bottom ones aren't killed.

strats.name: Kill Pirates Fast
strats.note: Kill the Pirates fast enough that they won't attack, or shoot them from above with Wave.
devNote: Technically it's not possible to kill the bottom Pirates while staying at node 2 (not dropping down);
but if we're not going down, then it doesn't matter that the bottom ones aren't killed.
FIXME: The enemyKill requirements could be reduced if it is only needed to kill the top ones, which could be modeled as a separate obstacle.

strats.name: Leave With Temporary Blue
note: Gain temporary blue with a shinecharge; then do a tight lateral mid-air morph to jump past the speed blocks.
Alernatively, start the temporary blue chain by doing a running jump over them rather than doing a shinecharge.

nodes.name: Bottom of Shaft
nodes.note: This node represents being at the bottom of the shaft with the acid just starting to rise.

nodes.name: Top of Shaft Without Acid Triggered
nodes.note: This node represents being at the top of the shaft without the acid having been triggered to rise.

to.note: The acid starts rising when Samus is at the bottom of the long fall
The acid starts rising when Samus is at the bottom of the long fall

strats.name: Base
strats.note: The pirates are free to kill, although they take some time.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb Pirate Kill
note: IBJ and use 10 PBs to kill the pirates and get to the top. Exit gmode and fall to the bottom.
Note that there is a path up to the right that doesn't need wall jumps, but a crouch jump down grab is needed to get to the final platform.

strats.name: Leave with Runway, Race the Acid
Kill Pirates With Speed
devNote: There are 19 unusable tiles in this runway.
It is not worthwhile to Shinespark into the room, because that would require more energy than the Pirates would deal.

strats.name: Crystal Flash Grapple Clip
note: Clear the Pirates near the door.
Jump into a Crystal Flash clip where the ceiling is a single tile thick.
Switch to Grappling Beam before the Crystal Flash ends and mash shoot while holding down.

strats.name: Protected Shaft Climb With Screw Attack
note: Use Screw Attack to avoid Space Pirate attacks while climbing the central shaft.
The Screw Attack effect is not active when Samus is preparing to Walljump.

strats.name: Protected Shaft Climb With PseudoScrew
note: Use Pseudo Screw to avoid Space Pirate attacks while climbing the central shaft.
The Screw Attack effect is not active when Samus is preparing to Walljump.

strats.name: Reverse Tourian Escape Room 4 Dodge While Climbing
note: Navigate Leodox Room in reverse by killing or distracting the right side pirates and manipulating or dodging the left side pirates during the shaft climb.
The acid starts rising when Samus is at the bottom of the long climb.
The right-side pirates can be killed while going down to prevent having to dodge their lasers during the climb.
Alternatively, jump and force the pirates to shoot just before starting to climb.

strats.name: Acid Bath Shinespark (Gravity)
note: Gain a shinecharge by running right-to-left at the bottom of the room.
Move quickly to minimize damage from the acid, which will begin rising as soon as you reach the bottom of the room.
Shinespark up the shaft.

strats.name: Tourian Escape Room 4 Suitless Acid Bath Shinespark
note: Gain a shinecharge by running right-to-left at the bottom of the room, performing a stutter just before the acid reaches Samus' feet.
Use spin jumps to minimize damage from the acid, and spark diagonally (to the left) mid-air to make it up the shaft.

strats.name: Tourian Escape Room 4 IBJ and Acid Bath
strats.note: Clear the right side Space Pirates and then race the rising acid by bomb jumping.

strats.name: Leave With Temporary Blue (Race the Acid)
Crystal Flash
strats.devNote: The Crystal Flash should be performed on a platform away from the acid trigger or any Pirates.
